intro: Allium transcaucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian leek, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces umbels of white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is adapted to temperate climates. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild, onion-like flavor. It is often cultivated for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
